translated: The Elder Single-Peaked Mountain’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
having gone to the end of all things,
distinguishing between existence and non-existence,
liberated many people.
At that time I was a king of geese,
the best of the birds,
and after finding a newborn calf,
I played a goose’s play.
Padumuttara, the knower of the world,
the receiver of offerings,
the Victor came right there🔽above the newborn calf.
After seeing the god of gods,
the self-dependent leader of the world,
I cut off the stalk of a lotus,
a hundred-petalled, delightful lotus.
After raising it with my beak,
delighted in the leader of the world,
after lifting it up in the sky,
I worshipped the best of the Buddhas.
Padumuttara, the knower of the world,
the receiver of offerings,
the Teacher, standing in the sky,
gave me his approval.
‘By this single lotus,
and by the intention and aspiration,
for a hundred thousand eons
you will not go to the lower realms.’
After saying this, the Buddha,
and the name of the lake was Uttama.
Having performed that deed,
I went to the place I had wished for.
For a hundred thousand aeons,
the deed I did then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations as well,
the six super-knowledges were experienced,
the Buddha’s instruction was accomplished.”🔽Thus the venerable Ekapadumiya recited these verses.
